speaker: Ashpath
line: Ash drifts like gray snow. A cottage door bulges inward, heat pushing against it as if the house wants out.

speaker: Trapped Child
line: H-help! The fire keeps talking. It says my name like it knows it!

choices.text: Force the door and pull the child free.
Talk the child through it—steady breath, steady hands.
Back away. This isn’t ordinary fire.

speaker: Trapped Child
line: I… I can move. I can move!

speaker: Watchman Sable
line: Good. Because we’ve seen that smoke before—on nights when the bell rings without hands. If you’re chasing answers, follow the ash trail toward Stonebridge.

speaker: Ashpath
line: The fire gutters. For a moment you swear the smoke watches you leave—disappointed, patient, and certain you’ll meet again.
